Description: Two fragments of papyrus, rubricised. One has text of Teaching of a Man for his Son on recto and verso.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Published by Fischer Elfert, JEA 84 (1998), 85-92. See J. Politi 'Gurob: The Papyri and the Burnt Group', GM 182 (2001), 107 ff. Other papyri from group in UCL: to be studied by F. Hagen (Cambridge).
J. F. Quack (pers.comm. 2013) notes the possibility that EA 10778 b+c and P. Amherst XIV and Berlin 15733c might have been part of a single roll.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381284) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381284)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, insect attack, loss Black ink (abraded) Red ink Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (fragmentary)
Associated titles: Teaching of a Man for his Son
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
